Heath Maguire Ok, I've added them to the 'Blog' category. The only thing, is that this two articles have a button at the bottom to download the Bridge to School newsletter...if you don't want it there for the main news, I'll have to duplicate the article..
Joao Henriques Ok that's great, just add those 2 articles to the category that displays in the news section then. We will have to upload the 3rd article, but no rush, it can wait until Monday, cheers

Heath Maguire but all the articles in the print newsletter are already done as articles in the website:


https://readytoread.com.au/bridge-to-school/


Can you explain what needs to be done, sorry but I'm not understanding.
Joao Henriques you did these in the print brochure for Bridge to School

Great idea Heath – please see below. Thanks, M


We had the pleasure of contributing to a recent Ellaslist article about literacy. In particular, the article highlights the importance of timing when it comes to literacy. There is a prevalent lack of awareness amongst parents about the benefits of early literacy and the options they have, which is set to exacerbate our already problematic literacy rates in Australia. However, the article mentions some initiatives to address the issue; and there are simple things that parents can do to start the journey towards literacy. For instance, it’s never too early to start reading books to your child; and yes, engaging in some early literacy activities to develop phonological awareness, phonemic awareness, handwriting and understanding of print concepts, goes a long way towards ensuring a child starts school ready to progress rather than set up to struggle. Think of it as strapping on a helmet before riding a bike – a proactive approach can prevent a child from struggling at school and can therefore avoid all of the subsequent impacts on their confidence, self-esteem and behaviour. Read the full article here.


From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Friday, June 15, 2018 2:00 PM
To: Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au>
Cc: David Mowbray <david@readytoread.com.au>; Support - WP Perk <support@wpperk.com>
Subject: Re: Farm Stays With Fireplaces + What You Should Know About Childhood Literacy


Hi Michelle,


Sure, we can do the 2 articles:


· Speech pathology article from Bridge to School


· Preparing your pre-school child for big school article from Bridge to School


Regarding the Ellaslist article, this needs a little extra work. We can’t simply copy and paste the article to your site as Google will see it as duplicate content and penalise your rankings. The best way to tackle this is write around 300-400 words in your own article and then link off to this article to ‘read more’ (or similar). Ideally in your articles copy you can highlight things such as:



  • The message you want your readers to take from the article

  • Your opinion on the subject matter of the article

  • Why you recommend that your readers head over and read this article


Essentially you should be seen to be adding value to this article and extending/commenting on it. Google then see’s your contribution as beneficial to it’s users and gives you some SEO brownie points. I hope that makes sense? If you reply to this email with the third articles content, we will upload it and link to the Ellaslist article.


Thanks and speak soon,


HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU


E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271


https://wolfiq.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/wolfiq-wpperk-signature-2018.png

Cosiest Farmstay Ever

Fresh air, a sky full of stars, adorable nursery animals… and the icing on the cake - a cracking fire place to keep you warm in winter! These are our favourite farm stay experiences with fireplaces - all just a drive away from Sydney.

Sick of taking your lunch to work? We found a meal subscription service offering 20 cent meals for next week. Get in (ma belly) quick!

Have a terrific weekend everyone!
Love, the ellaslist team xx

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/7e47d6d8-4c2d-4ae2-af02-fac132eacbd9.jpg

Ready To Read?
Unfortunately, many parents don’t think about literacy until their child is struggling at school – which then becomes a much bigger ship to turn. Find out what you can do.

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/55a5d459-6fd8-4d5c-80a5-334a0ac9765e.jpg

Sydney's First Science Playground
We all know that kids learn through play, so imagine how much they could learn in a science playground! Good news - Sydney is finally about to receive one.

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/f8628271-8f21-49e8-8065-70654581ec95.jpg

A Hole In One For Fun
With the coolest mini golf, an awesome inflatable world, ten pin bowling and coffee galore, this precinct is the one-stop shop for fun for the whole family.

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/a14f3ef2-a8f6-46d6-ba64-9ad8f3909435.jpg

Pawternity Leave Is Now A Thing
This new leave for pet owners is designed to help new parents show their adopted companions love and get them settled in. Does your company offer this?

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/155c8f3a-d91a-4c2a-9808-4d6855df40b2.jpg

A kid-friendly venue that is full of creativity, education, music, imaginative fun - and free! We, of course, are talking about libraries. Check out our favourites.

It's a one time offer for EOFY. Get 4 weeks free child care at one of Kids Club Australia's six star centres in the CBD, Surry Hills, Rosebery and Northern Beaches.

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/dbdb5852-5fe4-4e7d-b2d3-49ae8018d00e.jpg

https://gallery.mailchimp.com/3de77770806e6fba8d4e90545/images/14d390e4-0c09-4f98-be2c-84cdf630ee77.jpg
